page.title: 06TOWEDNACK - A RURAL SCENE.
page.content: {Towednack}is a tiny, mainly residential village.With exception of two working farms the whole of the village comprises of house's and cottages.There are{no shops,no public {telephones}and{no bus stops.}At the centre of the village is a small privately owned pond containing ducks and geese.The church is a well maintained example from the 13th century and still houses regular Sunday services to a small congregation of local people, led by Canon Cotter. Breja Farm,is the smallest of two{ {farms at Towednack.}Mr.Colin Nankervis and his wife run this largely animal biased farm on their own.They keep Ayreshire cattle for milking, sheep, pigs, chickens and 13 working dogs. Their sole crop is grass, for hay, silage and grazing.
